tasks.task: Raise calves in smallholder farming systems in East Africa.
subtasks: Cuddle newborn calf with mother for bonding (day 1-7).
Hand-milk cow twice a day to stimulate milk production.
Provide colostrum from mother to calf via bucket from day 3.
Ensure calf is separated from mother after week 1.
Provide milk to calf using a bucket (up to 6 liters/day in first 2 months, 2 liters in 3rd month, 0 liters in 4th month).
Move calves to wider grazing areas after 2 months, exposing them to forage and water.
House calves in raised pens treated with acaricides to prevent parasites (first two months).
Perform castration on male calves soon after birth if not for breeding.
Prevent underfeeding by consistently providing milk according to age.
Avoid water poisoning by not diluting milk with water.
Clean feeding containers regularly with disinfectants and sunlight.
Provide adequate housing to protect calves from cold and drafts.

tasks.task: Participate in extension courses and training materials for optimal results.
subtasks: Engage with mobile phone-based training programs provided by ILRI.
Complete interactive lessons and quizzes to enhance skills.
Invite extension service visits for further guidance.
